roleset.name: give a response, reaction

roles.note: ArgM-MNR and Arg2 can be hard to distinguish. Use the following ruleof thumb--if something is an adverb (X-ly) or can be easily restated -->--as an adverb ("with caution --> cautiously") call it ArgM-MNR.Otherwise use Arg2.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Not everyone is reacting so calmly.

example.name: transitive, adverbial reaction
example.text: The stock market reacted strongly to the news.

example.name: transitive, arg2 reaction
example.text: Investors -- taking this as a sign that a broad industry slump was in the offing -- reacted by selling the company's stock, which lost $3.25 that day to close at $52 in national over-the-counter trading.
example.arg: -- taking this as a sign that a broad industry slump was in the offing --
by selling the company's stock, which lost $3.25 that day to close at $52 in national over-the-counter trading

roleset.note: 'react' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; 'reactionary' based on BOLT-1. Verbnet class 31.3. Minimal comparison with 'answer' and 'respond'.
